text.section: The Commission consists of 9 members, appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate.

section.section: A member of the Commission may not hold an official relation to a licensee or hold any stocks, bonds, or other financial interest in a licensee.
Not more than 4 members who are appointed after July 1, 1989, may have a financial interest in racing in the State.
Not more than 6 members may be of the same political party.

text.section: Before taking office, each appointee to the Commission shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of a member of the Commission is 4 years and begins on July 1.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Commission on October 1, 1992.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

Subject to the hearing requirements of this subsection, the Governor, with the advice of the Secretary, may remove a member of the Commission for inefficiency, misconduct in office, or neglect of duty.
Before the Governor removes a member, the Governor shall give the member an opportunity for a public hearing.

At least 10 days before the hearing, the Governor shall give the member:
a copy of the charges; and
notice of the time and place of the hearing.
The member may be represented at the hearing by counsel.

If the Governor removes a member, the Governor shall submit to the Secretary of State:
a statement of all charges made against the member;
the findings of the Governor; and
a record of the proceedings.

text.section: The Governor shall appoint one member of the Commission to serve as a liaison to the State Lottery Commission established under Title 9 of the State Government Article.
